Based on my search results, I found information about popular fishing video games in 2025 that incorporate several of the elements you mentioned. Here's what I discovered:

## Popular Fishing Games with RPG Elements and Boss Battles (2025)

**Nice Day for Fishing** is a standout RPG where you play as Baelin the humble fisherman who must rise up to become the hero of Honeywood, featuring battles with fish using precision timing and magic spells while upgrading abilities. The game specifically warns players to "be wary of the boss fish looming in the deep, who will truly test your skills", directly addressing your interest in boss battles.

**The Catch** allows players to visit lakes, rivers, and oceans worldwide to capture over 35 diverse fish species and 100+ special "Boss Fish," with both single-player content and multiplayer components.

## Youth Gaming Appeal and Persistence Elements

Modern fishing games are becoming more accessible with "mobile-friendly competitive fishing game with fast-paced PvP battles" and "simple yet deep mechanics suitable for both casual and hardcore players". These games maintain engagement through "time-limited events and special challenges to keep gameplay fresh" along with "in-game achievements and unlockable rewards".

Some of the best RPGs available today are also home to memorable fishing games, and fishing minigames have proven popular enough to flourish across all RPG genres: turn-based RPGs, action RPGs, MMORPGs, and Strategy RPGs.

The search results show that 2025 has brought innovative fishing games that successfully blend traditional fishing mechanics with RPG progression systems, boss battles, and features designed to maintain long-term player engagement - exactly the combination of elements you were looking for.
